channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Influx of army recruits amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: Hundreds more New Zealanders are rushing to sign up to the Army amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Government to give $32m towards new aquatic centre in Hawke's Bay
item.description: A new regional aquatic centre in Hawke's Bay with an Olympic sized pool is being heralded as a "game changer".

item.title: NZ's first sci-fi WorldCon goes virtual this week
item.description: It reads like a classic sci-fi scenario - a deadly pandemic strikes just as an massive international convention is about to open in New Zealand, throwing everything into chaos.

item.title: 'Bank of Mum and Dad' putting parents at risk
item.description: Young people are turning to the 'Bank of Mum and Dad' under pressure, research shows, but it can be damaging for their backers, an expert says.

item.title: The Wild Twins: 'Our adventures just got more and more extreme'
item.description: Twin from Waiuku have survived the African wilderness on the tv show Naked and Afraid - and can add being stalked by a leopard to their already impressive list of adventures.

item.title: New list of potentially listeria contaminated products for recall
item.description: The Ministry for Primary Industries has put out further information regarding a recall of products from a Talbot Forest Cheese factory which may be contaminated with listeria.

item.title: Mediawatch: halted magazines to be revived
item.description: Some of the magazines that vanished during lockdown could be revived soon, thanks to new buyers.

item.title: Couch potatoes allowing muscles 'to melt away' - US expert
item.description: Chairs can harm people's health, and people should instead practise active resting such as kneeling and squatting similar to an indigenous group in Tanzania, an expert says.

item.title: Pumped hydro may result in 'biggest infrastructure project since the 1980s'
item.description: The government is injecting $30 million into an investigation that may lead to 100 percent renewable electricity generation.

item.title: Kiwis' failure to propagate an 'instinctive reaction' to drought
item.description: Hungry kiwi in Hawke's Bay have put their own survival ahead of producing more eggs, as the region was gripped by a prolonged drought.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in NZ today for fourth day this week
item.description: No new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in New Zealand today for the second day in a row.

item.title: Auckland ferry passengers in line for cheaper trips
item.description: Ferry passengers in Auckland are in line for cheaper trips from today.

item.title: Precarious state of New Plymouth water network highlighted in report
item.description: An independent engineer's report recommending a $2.5 million repair job on a 40-year-old stormwater culvert near State Highway 3 in New Plymouth, has drawn attention to the vulnerable state of the district's water network.

item.title: Students call for climate action restart after Covid-19
item.description: New Zealand's success eliminating Covid-19 should be a springboard to reboot climate action, a group of Christchurch teens say - and they've already started the dirty work - with tree planting.

item.title: S Canty pilot who died in microlight crash named
item.description: The pilot who died in a microlight plane crash in rural South Canterbury yesterday was 60-year-old Trevor Shadbolt of Pukaki.

item.title: Riding on the footpath: NZTA delays decision until after election
item.description: The Transport Agency says the large number of submissions on the proposal means the decision will take longer.

item.title: Highlanders investigate reports of unruly behaviour involving players
item.description: The Highlanders rugby franchise are investigating reports of unruly behaviour involving its players in Queenstown.

item.title: Family who escaped from Covid-19 isolation facility were in NZ to attend funeral
item.description: Four teenagers who fled from a managed isolation facility in Hamilton last night with their mother had been denied permission to attend their father's funeral. Watch the government's latest media conference here.
